summary: The diff demonstrates comprehensive implementation of all requirements including backend approval request persistence, frontend UserManagementModule display logic, extensive debug logging throughout the approval lifecycle, and role-based access control enforcement. All acceptance criteria appear to be addressed with detailed console logging, proper error handling, and access restrictions for secondary admins.

hallucinated_features.description: Manual refresh functionality with RefreshCw icon and toast notifications in UserManagementModule
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest REQ-2 mentions 'List refreshes automatically or on manual trigger' as acceptance criteria, but does not explicitly request the implementation of a refresh button UI component with toast feedback. The manual refresh capability exceeds the minimum requirement of verifying correct fetching/display.

hallucinated_features.description: Polling/auto-refresh intervals configured in useQueries.ts with specific millisecond values (APPROVAL_PENDING_REFRESH_INTERVAL = 5000ms)
hallucinated_features.reason: While REQ-2 mentions automatic list refresh, the BuildRequest does not specify polling intervals or auto-refresh mechanisms. The implementation adds sophisticated polling infrastructure not explicitly requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Timestamp tracking and execution timing measurements in ProfileSetup approval flow
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-3 requests comprehensive debug logging with confirmation messages and counts, but does not specifically request performance timing measurements (approvalStartTime/approvalEndTime calculations) or ISO timestamp logging.

hallucinated_features.description: Access denied UI with custom icon, multiple explanatory paragraphs, and styled Card component for non-admin users
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-4 requests verification of role-based access control and proper restrictions, but does not specify the implementation of a dedicated access denied UI screen with custom graphics and detailed messaging.
